experience.description:
to Self-Learn Frontend Developer 
------- 
Work in casino industry for more than 5 years and always using applications that counts, register and search through a huge database of clients, make me interest more about how it works and how it can be speed up, UI/UX improved. 
 This definitely convinced me to start learn and build JavaScript applications. I finished to learn at Hexlet.io and Udemy.com, and soon deployed my own Casino Float on Heroku: https://casino- 
float.herokuapp.com/ based on casino workers requests and their troubleshooting during work. Developing this app, I used this technologies: 
 * for Backend: Express.Js/NodeJs for server and mongoose/mongoDB for database, created a full REST api with its own database and methods, implemented routes and cors, data validation, and routes error handled. 
 * for Frontend: to build a faster app which runs on tablets, I decided to write SPA in React and Client Side Rendering. Data are fetched with axios (CRUD operations implemented), and stored with Redux and placed in app where/when it needs and same with updating/patching. Router implemented, momentjs, fakerjs and more new technologies. Styled without any external libraries/frameworks. 
 At the moment I design mockups in Adobe XD and implementing them in React for freelance. 
 Great advantage in building apps is advanced knowledge of English / 
Russian / Romanian which helps a lot to read and documentation.
